\nCancer survivors raise the spirits\n.description: As many as 100 cancer survivors along with their doctors celebrated National Cancer Survivors’ Day at IMA Bhawan. The doctors including Dr Sachin Gupta, Dr Sunanadan Sharma, Dr Gautam Goel ,Dr Ritesh Pruthi, Dr Pankaj Kumar and Dr Sajal Kakkar from a Mohali hospital joined survivors in bhangra. Sandeep Dogra said that all have gathered today to show the world that life after a cancer treatment is equally rewarding, fulfilling and inspiring. A jubilant survivor, Surbhi (37) from Pinjore said, “My treatment went on for about 9-month, which was pretty long, but it made me stronger as a person and now I feel fearless and ready to take on any challenge that life will throw at me. The journey completely transformed my outlook towards life & personality and has increased my self-belief.” Another survivor, Amritpal Kaur from Jalandhar said, “Many aspects of life have changed for me like others who sailed in the same boat. No more crying over little issues and most importantly, I have started to sincerely value my life, by taking care of my diet, fitness and most importantly, doing what makes me feel happy.” “My will power to fight cancer came solely from the love and support, i got from my family during the treatment. As a survivor, i request each and every family member to be very positive, calm and hopeful whenever around the patient.”, maintained Lakhwinder from Chandigarh Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Two Mohali cops injured in clash with pr.description: MOHALI: A police party was assaulted by a proclaimed offender in an attempt to arrest him on Sunday. ASI Jaspal Singh and his gunman constable Jograj Singh were injured in the incident and their vehicle was also damaged in the melee. ASI Jaspal Singh sustained injuries in his shoulder, head and arm while Jograj sustained injury in his hands. They were taken to civil hospital in Kharar for treatment while woman subinspector Jasbir Kaur escaped unhurt. However, cops managed to arrest Harchand Singh, a proclaimed offender in various land fraud and cheating cases. Singh is accused of selling a plot without giving its possession. The case was registered on June 22, 2015. SSP Harcharan Singh Bhullar while conforming the incident said that a police party conducted a raid to arrest a wanted criminal headed by Majri police station house officer but as soon as the police zeroed in on the wanted criminal in retaliation, he attacked the police party. Jaspal Singh said he along with Jasbir Kaur and his gunman Jograj Singh went to Choti Nangal village in Majri block of Mullanpur to arrest Singh from his house. Police party went as pulse polio team and managed to identify the PO and as the team arrested him disclosing their identity, the wife and son of the accused started pelting bricks and stones at them. The accused also damaged the police vehicle. A case was registered under sections 186 (obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions), 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 332 (voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty), 342 (wrongful confinement) and 427 (mischief causing damage) of the IPC against Shinder Kaur and her son Harjit Singh. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Banker\u2019s purse snatched in Panchkul.description: PANCHKULA: Two men on a motorcycle allegedly snatched a purse from a woman posted as a head cashier at a Punjab National Bank (PNB) branch near her house in Sector 11 on Sunday evening. Reeta said was taking a walk when the accused sneaked up on her from behind and one of them grabbed her purse around 5 pm. By the time she could react, the accused sped away. Police registered a case under section 379 A (punishment for snatching) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).). Assistant sub-inspector (ASI) Pratap Singh, the investigating officer, said the investigation is under progress. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nNGO organizes fund raiser for special.description: Model and actress, Neet Mahal was in town recently to take part in a fund raiser event for special children. In the event, she was joined by Gagan Verma, Mr Supermodel Universe, Ruby Singh, actor and model and fitness expert Dr Vibha Bawa, winner of North Indian Queen 2018 and Ayurveda expert Sanjana Sharma, ex-banker and Mrs. India Beauty Queen 2018, Dr Tetiana Kapranova an endocrinologist, therapist and fashion model, Sam Rattan, actor-model and anchor, Dr Rimple Sharma, Mrs. Chandigarh Queen 2018. ‘Elysian Diva’, the fund raiser event was organized by Empower, a city based project, which works for special children betterment in association with Surkhwabh. The event was also a tribute to the supreme sacrifice of Deputy Commandant Joy Lal whose 20 th martyrdom day falls on May 30. During occasion, around dozen special children walked the ramp along with celebrities. Wheelchair Indian Cricket team players including Ranjit Singh, Nirmal Singh and Veer Singh Sandhu also joined kids in ramp walk and show. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

At GMSH, OPDs close at 8.30am, patients.description: CHANDIGARH: The ripple effect of the nation-wide strike against assault on junior doctors in West Bengal was witnessed in the city as doctors of Government Multispecialty Hospital (GMSH), Sector 16, also boycotted work on Monday. Showing solidarity to the cause, however, caused inconvenience to patients who had come to avail treatment there. The out-patient department (OPD) of GMSH was shut down at 8.30am following which a large number of patients were turned away without medical aid. “I came from Derabassi at 7am so that I could get the patient card made at the earliest. But then at 8.30am, they closed down the OPD. We still kept waiting for a few hours but had to return at last as no one tended to us. We will have to come back next week now,” said Sadhu Ram, a patient. Dr Amir Ali, a representative of the student council, claimed that India contributes the least amount of their GDP to health services (1.5%) as compared to the other countries which give at least 5-6% for the same. “As a result, even the equipment is inadequate to provide proper treatment. This leads to poor health services and discontent among the patients and their family members.” The doctors of GMSH on Friday had taken out a silent protest by wearing black badges, but on Monday, they too joined to the work strike. A doctor requesting anonymity said, “Our motive is not to make the patients suffer, but there has to be a solution. Our voices need to be heard.” The emergency services continued to work as usual. However, some patients faced problems as there was delay in treatment. A woman who had given birth just a week ago had been waiting for her child to get treated for jaundice, but couldn’t due to the ongoing strike. “They may be on strike, but isn’t a life more important than their demands for now?” she complained. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nA peep into Haryanavi culture\n.description: Candigarh Sangeet Natak Akademi in collaboration with Haryana Kala Parishad organized Daaman Ki Phatkar- The Mirror of Haryanvi culture. A programme based on Haryanvi culture, it presented folk songs, dances, and Haryanvi comedy skit, directed by Ravi Shankar. It began with the Saraswati Vandana, followed by Haryanvi dance. A song 'Mere yaar Sudama Re,' by Isha Panchal and group dance by Bham Lehri were also presented. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Farmers get relief cheques 2 days before.description: JIND: The farmers of Safidon town in Jind district on Tuesday accused the local patwari (revenue official) of giving them compensation cheques just two days before their expiry date. They have urged the sub-divisional magistrate to look into the matter and act against the patwari. A farmer from Nimnabad village, Major Singh said their compensation was approved in March after a girdawari last year to assess loss to the paddy crop due to flood waters. “But patwari Mangal Singh distributed cheques to farmers on Friday, just two days before their expiry date. As the next two days were Saturday and Sunday, the bank was closed. When we approached to bank for releasing the payment, they refused, saying the encashment date of cheques was over,” he said. While Major Singh got a cheque of Rs 11,000, another farmer Karnail Singh got a compensation of Rs 7,150 and Balinder Singh Rs 12,000. Around 25 to 30 other farmers have also got compensation cheques of similar amount but are still waiting to get them encashed. Safidon SDM Mandeep Kumar said he had taken cognizance of the matter and would urge the bank to release the farmers’ money and if the bank does not do the needful, he would get all the cheques renewed through a proper process. “Even a single rupee of farmers would be given to them at the earliest. May be the delay was may be due to model code of conduct or slow processing of generating cheques by bank officials, but dues would be cleared at the earliest and famers don’t need to worry,” he said. Eco Sikh plants 550 trees of 15 native v.description: CHANDIGARH : In a bid to increase the green cover, Eco-Sikh , a global organisation of Sikh community committed toward the development of the environment, planted the 15th Guru Nanak sacred forest in the compound of Kheti Bhawan in Directorate of Horticulture department of Punjab government in Mohali on Tuesday. According to Pavneet Singh, assistant manager , some 550 trees of 15 native tree varieties such as Amaltas, Shisham, Baheda, Ashwagandha etc were planted on a 180 sq meter land. Five hundred and fifty saplings are being planted in each such sacred forest to commemorate the upcoming 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev ji.  Quite interestingly, two of the trainees , Ravinder Singh and Kulbir Singh and, students of Public College in Samana, who took training in plantation of eco-forest at Bathinda where Punjab's first Guru Nanak Sacred forest was created , prepared the new forest. Both of them have spearheaded the efforts in setting up some seven new sacred forests, at Kheri Talwandi Malik in Samana , Meemsa in Sangrur, Kheri Jattan , another in village of Fatehgarh Sahib, DC complex and Directorate of Horticulture department in Mohali, so far. Speaking about the new skill of forest making acquired three months ago, from the mentor , a well known environmentalist Shubhendu Sharma, Ravinder Singh said, “I had some free time after completing course of BSC Agriculture which I am utilizing in serving the society with pious work of creating sacred forests as a homage to the Guru Nanak Dev Ji. It is also service to environment which is fast eroding.” He said that it was honour for them that officials of agriculture department also enriched their experience with their tips during this activity.” Kulbir Singh , said that the technique of growing forest with Japenese Miyawaki was so simple that anybody could learn it and do wonders with splendid forest which grows and expands faster without demanding much maintenance and care. Ravneet Singh,  Eco-Sikh project manager said, “The officials of Punjab forest department has been assisting us a lot by providing saplings for our sacred forests across the state. Besides this, we are also purchasing the bulk from the nurseries in Saharanpur as the saplings are not available in sufficient quantity in Punjab alone.” He further told that ateam of eight coordinators of Eco-Sikh were facilitated training in the forest creation technique from Shubhendu Sharma and Gaurav Gujjar at their Jodhpur center sometime ago. He expressed hope that with several trained hands committed in this mission, they would be able to create lot of sacred forests in Punjab by November this year. One in Kasur area of Pakistan has already been created by their team . They said that the efforsts of the eam would continue till they realise their green dreams . The volunteers say that they have also been able to generate awareness also about s variety of native trees. The locals are being told about the native tree saplings. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Punjab and Haryana High Court seeks repl.description: CHANDIGARH: The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Monday asked the Punjab government to submit a reply in the matter regarding two-year-old Fatehveer of Bhagwanpura village in Sangrur district who had died after falling into an unused borewell. The state has to inform the court about the reasons that led to the death of the child, factors that caused delay in the rescue operation and the steps which the state is going to take to prevent such incidents in the future. The matter has been fixed for July 3 for further hearing. The division bench comprising Justice Anupinder Singh Grewal and Justice Harnaresh Singh Gill passed these orders while hearing a petition filed in public interest regarding Fatehveer's death. Additional solicitor general of India and senior advocate Satya Pal Jain informed the court that innocent minor children are losing their lives in such incidents and some steps are needed to be taken to ensure such incidents do not occur in future again. Jain also explained the guidelines/dos and don'ts issued by the Supreme Court in 2010 regarding digging of borewells, which included putting a notice board near the borewell and setting up a wall around it. Seeking court's intervention on the issue, Jain asked the court to seek report if the apex court guidelines are being complied with by the Punjab government regarding borewells and to find out the reasons of delay on the part of the authorities in the latest case. The matter has reached the high court in the wake of a petition filed by Parminder Singh Sekhon, seeking a probe into the incident that led to the death of minor boy. Sekhon pleaded for fixing the responsibility of erring officials and further directions to formulate policy and procedure for digging borewells so as to avoid any untoward incident in the future. The petitioner has demanded compensation to the victim's family because of the crucial time wasted by the officials in retrieving the boy. Two-year-old Fatehveer had fallen into a 150-foot-deep borewell on June 6 and was brought out of it after a 108-hour rescue operation. The boy was, however, declared dead when taken to PGI, Chandigarh on June 11. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Exam for post of naib tehsildar: HC lens.description: CHANDIGARH: Taking cognizance of a plea seeking cancellation of the written examination recently conducted by the Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC) for recruitment on naib tehsildar’s post, the Punjab and Haryana high court has fixed July 8 for hearing the petition The matter came under HC scanner after Bhiwani resident Devender Singh and seven other candidates who took the exam, filed a petition, seeking re-examination. Their contention is that despite the arrest of several persons for allegedly leaking the question paper for selection of naib tehsildars, the commission has not cancelled the examination. The petitioner informed the HC that the exam papers were leaked in Karnal and police were able to nab a whole gang of persons who were involved in supplying the same to a large number of candidates. “When the paper was leaked, then the sanctity of the test was itself lost and the HPSC should have cancelled the same and ordered re-examination. It was just one gang that was caught. What about the other or others who were not caught or detected and the persons to whom it was further circulated, as today just a click of button on phone sends the same to thousands,” the petitioners’ counsel Saurabh Dalal submitted to the HC. Dalal also contended that the state machinery and the HPSC were not capable of handling and conducting the exam and even if a single candidate got the answer key to the leaked paper, the future of thousands of other candidates would be at stake on account of unfair means by some. He also submitted that the state and the HPSC should employ fool-proof measures of conducting examinations so that the future of those who have put in years of hard work and dedication is not jeopardized. The petitioners have prayed for cancellation of the examination held on May 26 and re-conduct of the written examination. In July 2015 and May 2018, the HPSC had issued advertisement for the selection of 70 posts of naib tehsildar (Group-B) in revenue and disaster management department, Haryana. The commission conducted the written exam in various districts of Haryana on May 26. The Haryana Police claim to have busted a gang allegedly involved in leaking the examination paper at Rewari on May 26. The paper leak was cracked by Rewari Police and the special task force (STF), Gurgaon, on the basis of secret information. According to preliminary investigation, the paper was leaked in Karnal and solved in Gurgaon. The answer keys were to be provided to candidates in Rewari centre but the accused were nabbed before that. The HPSC declared the result of the written examination on June 13. Now, traders may be involved for impleme.description: CHANDIGARH: As the UT administration and the Chandigarh municipal corporation is facing stiff opposition from various traders’ body on creating vending zones in city, the administration now plans to involve traders and various market bodies for implementation of street vending policy. A senior UT official said they want to accommodate vendors in different vending zones in the city, but with the consent of traders as well. They have now planned to involve traders, while creating vending zones in the city. The final decision in this regard will be taken next week, he added. There were protests from traders of sectors 17, 15 and 22, in recent past against the UT and MC’s move to rehabilitate vendors in these markets. On the other side, the Chandigarh municipal corporation has completed the first round of the draw of lots already and allotted 3,000 street-vending sites around the city. It has suspended the process for the time being, since the matter was pending before the Punjab and Haryana high court. The town vending committee has already approved a fine of Rs 50,000 and registration of a criminal case if any vendor is found procuring fake certificates. The authorities will check the documents of the vendors time and again and in the coming days certificates equipped with security feature will be issued to them. Recently, the Punjab and Haryana high court had expressed its dissatisfaction over the definition given by the UT under the Street Vending Act. The high court had pointed out that how come footpaths and parking zones could be called streets. The HC also had made a satirical remark and said that if footpaths and parking zones could be streets then UT should also include parks under the Street Vending Act and allow street vendors there. There are a total 9,200 vendors in the city. Of these, 1,900 deal with essential commodities and they will stay at their existing place of vending due to the nature of their services. Besides, 6,500 registered vendors deal in non-essential commodities, who will be accommodated in vending zones identified by the Chandigarh administration. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Punjab chief secretary reviews preparati.description: SULTANPUR LODHI: As he reviewed preparations being made for celebrating 550th anniversary of Guru Nanak in this historic town, Punjab chief secretary Karan Avtar made it clear to the officials that all the ongoing works must be completed before September 30 this year. Chairing a meeting to review the preparations of the mega event here at office of the market committee, the chief secretary, accompanied by Commissioner Jalandhar division B Purusartha and Inspector General of Police Naunihal Singh said that the celebrations during the mega event would start from November 5 and holy city would witness huge rush of devotees till November 15, so all the ongoing development works needed to be completed before September end. He said that any sort of callousness in this task would not be tolerated at any cost. "The commemorative events must be a spectacular show for which every officer/ official must perform their duty zealously," he said. The chief secretary said that any sort of inordinate delay in execution of work was unwarranted and undesirable. He also said that besides ensuring prompt execution of work the officers must also make sure that the work was conducted as per the highest specifications of quality. In a big bonanza for the residents of Sultanpur Lodhi, he said that Bebe Nanaki Memorial University College for Girls would start professional courses like BCA/B Com from July 1 adding that this would provide an opportunity to girls of the region to have an access to quality education. The chief secretary also said that three tented cities to facilitate around 40,000 pilgrims would be erected at around 280 acres of land in Sultanpur Lodhi. Special arrangements would be made to ferry the pilgrims via rail and road route to Gurudwara Sahib, he said adding that fencing of Kali Bein would be done at two kilometres area which was vulnerable to avoid any sort of mishap. Chief secretary also said that a bio-diversity park would be set up on 8 acres of land as a part of the event adding that Nanak Bagichi would also come up in front of SDM office at Sultanpur Lodhi. He said that a hi-end light and sound show would be held at the holy city during the mega event. He also asked the various departments to ensure proper disposal of solid and liquid waste management during the celebrations. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandigarh: Patients face distress as do.description: CHANDIGARH: As the staff of Government Medical College and Hospital, Sector 32, joined the doctors’ pan-India strike on Monday, the out-patient department (OPD) saw a beeline of patients waiting to seek treatment while doctors remained absent from duty. Long queues were also seen outside the abandoned registration booth. “The OPD has been overflowing with patients waiting since morning,” said Kuldeep Singh of Kurukshetra adding, “I have been here for 4 hours now, but they have given our files back and are not accepting any patient. My mother has cancer and I have travelled for nearly 70km for her treatment, but no doctors are available. “My child is sick, but there is no one to provide treatment,” said 33-year-old Usha of Ambala. Thousands of patients who come to the facility everyday have been left with no choice but to wait for the strike to end. Meanwhile, the hospital is jam-packed with patients and their family members as doctors remain away. A nurse from the OPD confirmed that emergency services are still being provided, but elective surgeries have been put on hold, as no doctor on OPD duty has reported to the hospital since morning. Consultants have been instructed to guide the patients, yet hundreds of them remain stranded. The delay in treatment has caused many patients to wait in the already full hallways of the hospital. As a result, there is lack of space, beds and wheelchairs for the patients. The skeletal staff at the hospital is overburdened and is unable accept reports of OPD patients. A patient complained, “Just because the doctors on strike, we are suffering and even basic treatment is being denied to us. People coming from outside the city are having trouble in accommodating themselves and have been sitting on the hospital floor for many hours.” “We should not be made to suffer at the cost of our health,” said another patient. As per information, the doctors will stage a protest in the evening to demand safety and security measures for them. Amid all the chaos, the emergency department remained functional and necessary treatment and care is still being given to critical patients cases. The OPD, however, saw no action on the day. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Asaduddin Owaisi.description: NEW DELHI: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM), was greeted with slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram', 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' on Tuesday as he went on to take oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha here. Owaisi, a Member of Parliament (MP) from Hyderabad constituency, in response, said, "Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allahu Akbar, Jai Hind" while concluding his oath. Later, responding to opposition's gesture, Owaisi told ANI, "I think, it's good that they remember such things after seeing me. I hope they remember our constitution and the deaths of children in Muzaffarpur as well. I will keep an eye on them." Besides, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) lone MP from Punjab's Sangrur, Bhagwant Mann, raised 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogans at the end of his oath-taking ceremony earlier today. #WATCH: Slogans of Bharat Mata ki Jai and Vande Mataram raised in the Lok Sabha as AIMIM MP from Hyderabad Asaduddi… https://t.co/6QTgnFYG6x— ANI (@ANI) 1560854690000This comes after BJP MP from Bhopal Pragya Singh Thakur ended her oath taking ceremony with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan on Monday. Subsequently, every BJP member continued to raise slogans. Moreover, chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' marked the oath-taking by minister Babual Supriyo, elected from Asansol in West Bengal, where the chanting of the slogan became a political issue during the recent elections. The furore over 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan started in the state after West Bengal chief minister Banerjee lost her cool when a group of men chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' as her convoy was passing through Bhatpara area in North 24 Parganas district earlier this month. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Chandigarh Housing Board holds draw of l.description: CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh Housing Board (CHB) on Tuesday held computerized draw of lots for allotment of 52 small flats under Slum Rehabilitation Programme at Maloya Housing complex. The eligibility of the applicant was recommended by the UT estate office. Besides, another computerized draw was conducted for the two applicants of the Oustees Scheme. Both the applicants got dwelling units in Sector 63. To maintain transparency and fairness, both computerized draws were held in presence of applicants and under the supervision of senior officers of UT administration as independent judges. Yashpal Garg, chief executive officer (CEO), CHB, said draw of the result has been uploaded on the website of CHB (www.chbonline.in). A copy of the result has also been provided on the notice board of the CHB, he added. The administration rehabilitates slum-dwellers after conducting a biometric survey. The colonies resettled in the last ten years include Colony No 5, Nehru Colony, Kuldeep Colony and Mazdoor Colony. The allottees will have to pay Rs 1,000 as licence fee every month for 20 years after which they will pay the balance to get the ownership of the flat. The construction of the flats in Maloya had begun in June 2014 at a cost of Rs 250 crore under the Jawaharlal Nehru Urban Renewal Mission (JNNURM). Prime Minister Narendra Modi was to hand over the flat keys to the allottees in May last year, but couldn’t do so as the project was incomplete. The project, construction which began in 2014, was originally meant to be completed by 2016, but it got delayed by more than two years. Chandigarh Housing Board is the nodal body for the construction of rehabilitation colonies. So far, it has built 12,736 of the total 25,728 flats proposed for slum-dwellers. Of these, around 12,000 were built in sectors 38(W), 49, Dhanas, Mauli Jagran–II and Ram Darbar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No power tariff hike in Chandigarh, says.description: CHANDIGARH: Providing major relief to the residents, the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) approved the electricity department’s petition, wherein they had not proposed any hike in power tariff for financial year 2019-20. As per the latest orders of the JERC, the new tariff will be applicable from June 1 and will remain valid till further orders from the commission. The electricity department in its power tariff petition submitted before the JERC had stated that there will be a surplus of Rs 18.65 crore for period between financial year 2017-18 to 2019-20, therefore the department did not propose any power tariff hike. Last time, the JERC had marginally increased rates in domestic and commercial categories and had reduced rates in the industrial category for the financial year 2018-19. In the domestic category, rate were increased from Rs 2.55 to Rs 2.75 in the slab of 0-150 units, while there was no change in the rate of Rs 4.80 in the slab of 151-400 unit. In the slab of above 400 units, the rate was increased from Rs 5 to Rs 5.20 per unit. Along the similar lines, a small increase in the commercial consumer category was also made. In the commercial category, there was no change in the rate of Rs 5 in the slab between 0-150 units, while in slab of 151-400, rate was increased from Rs 5.20 to Rs 5.30 per unit. In above 400 slab, rate was increased from Rs 5.45 to Rs 5.60 per unit. In the latest petition, the UT Electricity Department had also submitted that they had started a drive against defaulters. The department submitted that they had issued notices to defaulters and even disconnected power supply of major defaulters. As per the latest list, there are total 270 defaulters, who owe over Rs 10 crore to the electricity department. Out of the 270 defaulters, the department had disconnected connections of around 50% consumers while the remaining are tangled in dispute with the department. Panchkula traffic police get 25 new bike.description: PANCHKULA:Haryana director general of police (DGP) Manoj Yadava on Monday launched 25 special motorcycles at the Sector 14 police station. These bikes will assist the Panchkula police commissionerate quick response team (QRT) to provide road safety. The new motorcycles have been added to traffic unit of Panchkula under the initiative. The QRT team was flagged off by Haryana DGP along with Panchkula police commissioner (CP) Saurabh Singh and deputy commissioner of police (DCP) Kamaldeep Goyal. The motorcycles equipped with sirens and flash lights have been given by a private company as per its corporate social responsibility) initiative. Harbhajan Singh, director of the private company manufacturing the motorcycles, was also present on the occasion. Goyal said, “These QRT bikes will help them in traffic safety and prove helpful in controlling criminal activities like theft and snatching in the district.” CP Singh said, “All QRT vehicles will reach the accident spot at the earliest and ensure the smooth flow of traffic apart from helping the injured to get medical help and evacuating them at the earliest”. The DGP said, “The commissionerate should use these QRT vehicles for safety on national and state highways. The accident-prone areas of the commissionerate should be checked and cops issue challans on these stretches.” There are 28 PCR and 26 motorcycle riders deployed in the district day and night for crime control. Now, the addition of these 25 new motorcycles in district police will further aid in controlling the crime effectively, officials said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No decision yet on fate of five MLAs who.description: CHANDIGARH: Five Punjab MLAs, who were elected on AAP ticket but later resigned from the party’s primary membership, continue to enjoy government perks and facilities taking benefit of the lacunae in law which does not prescribe any time limit for the legislative assembly speaker to decide such cases. MLAs Harvinder Singh Phoolka (Dakha), Sukhpal Singh Khaira (Bholath) and Master Baldev Singh (Jaito) resigned from AAP’s primary membership in January. Ahead of the parliamentary elections, two other AAP MLAs — Nazar Singh Manshahia (Mansa) and Amarjit Singh Sandoa (Ropar) — joined the Congress on April 25 and May 4, respectively. Khaira had by then floated his own Punjab Ekta Party, which Master Baldev later joined. Thereafter, Khaira and Master Baldev contested the parliamentary elections from Bathinda and Faridkot, respectively, but lost. Assembly speaker Rana KP Singh told TOI, “Their cases are under consideration. We have called them and will hear what they have to say. There is no such time frame.” Though the state government is yet to take a final call, the state assembly’s monsoon session is likely to be held in July. Also, till cases of these five legislators are pending with the Speaker, they remain MLAs and have the right to attend the assembly session too. Leader of opposition and AAP MLA Harpal Singh Cheema blamed the Speaker of delaying the decision on disqualification of these MLAs. “The Speaker is intentionally delaying hearing in these cases. Khaira is being given longer dates of hearing so that he continues to speak against AAP while enjoying government facilities as MLA. Manshahia and Sandhoa had sent their resignations to the Speaker but they have been given next date of hearing in July or August,” he added. Asked why AAP has not been taking up Master Baldev’s case for disqualification like that of Khaira, Cheema replied, “We are soon going to write to the Speaker against Master Baldev Singh. We are also going to send a reminder to the Speaker in a day or two for Khaira’s disqualification as MLA.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Haryana receives more rain than Punjab.description: JIND: Three-day span of intermittent rain in the region has benefited farmers as well as public thanks to the drop in temperature. Director of Indian meteorology department in Chandigarh Surender Pal said that farmers would need less water for irrigating their field, especially in case of paddy. “The rain has helped in sowing kharif crops and it’s a good sign for every one as people got relief from scorching heat wave in the region. The data taken form IMD department in Chandigarh shows that Hisar received highest rainfall in Haryana state with 36.7mm in last 24 hours and lowest in Palwal district at 1.7 mm. The data compiled by metrology department shows that Chandigarh recorded highest rainfall at 23.9mm, Haryana 16 mm and Punjab 14.9mm from Monday to Tuesday. Head of meteorology department in Chaudhary Charan Singh Haryana Agriculture University M L Khichar said, “Rain is good for cotton, jawar, bajra, guwar and paddy as famers can skip one irrigation of their fields.” He said that 30.4 degree Celsius temperature was highest and 20 degree was lowest on Tuesday in Hisar. Talking to TOI, national vice-president of Bhartiya Kisan Union Ramphal Kandela agreed with experts on benefit to farmers. Phool Singh Sheokand, a farmer in Jind , said that the rainfall is beneficial for most crops especially in dry area which don’t have irrigation sources. \nSummer camp concludes\n.description: This summer, DPS, Chandigarh organised a summer camp for the children from May 16 to June 1, 2019 for tiny tots and May 22 to June 1, 2019 for senior group. The children participated in a number of fun activities like I- spy game, sprinkler fun, Bollywood day, theme parties, grooming sessions and art and craft. Theatre Robotics and Nutty Scientist were offered to students in the senior category. The camp concluded with a special celebration of Father's Day (junior category), and a theatre display (senior category). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandigarh\u2019s heritage furniture auc.description: CHANDIGARH: In yet another auction of artefacts belonging to the city, furniture items designed by Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret were auctioned for Rs 1.12 crore in New York. While the UT administration failed to preserve its heritage items, a London-based auction house Phillips once again auctioned three heritage furniture items of city beautiful on June 6. A sofa set designed for the high court and Assembly was auctioned for Rs 34.80 lakh, while a pair of armchair was sold for Rs 69.60 lakh. Besides, an executive desk designed for administrative buildings of Chandigarh went under the hammer for Rs 7.39 lakh. Le Corbusier and his cousin Pierre Jeanneret had designed the aforementioned items. Both used to design chairs, tables, stools, and racks for government offices in the late 1950s. The designed furniture lot was replaced in the late 1980s and early 1990s, after which the administration had tossed the items in its backyards and stores. Unaware of the furniture's international worth, most UT departments had auctioned the old furniture thinking it as junk. Meanwhile, activist Ajay Jagga has written to the home minister, Amit Shah and minister for external affairs Subrahmanyam Jaishankar and sought inquiry into the auction of these furniture items. He further requested the authorities to look into the matter and seek a report on the Protection Against Trafficking in Cultural Property, specially of Chandigarh, so that the loopholes can be plugged and a suitable action be taken, after ascertaining the facts. To preserve its heritage artefacts, Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) had recently asked the UT administration for taking corrective steps. Director general of ASI had advised the administration to prepare an inventory of heritage items with subsequent authentication of their authorship. The ASI had also suggested that a museum dedicated to Le Corbusier and his team can be established by the administration, which will prevent taking these works of art out of India. Heritage furniture goes under the hammer During his stay in Chandigarh, Le Corbusier and Pierre Jeanneret designed several pieces of furniture. Some of the prototypes are present at Government Museum and Art Gallery, Sector 10. Jeanneret used the furniture in the house he stayed in at Sector 5. He was so fond of the city that after his death, his ashes were immersed in Sukhna Lake as he had desired. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Teeth, cloth help kin identify body in M.description: MOHALI: The body of a man, who was found burnt in Mohali last week has been identified by his family members. The deceased, Ramesh Kumar of Raebareli, was residing in Mohali and was a soup vendor. The deceased has been identified from his teeth, chin and a piece of cloth, which he used regularly. "The body has been sent for postmortem, which would be conducted by a panel of doctors at Rajindra hospital in Patiala," said Sohana station house officer inspector Manphul Singh. Manphul said, "Family members of the deceased (his daughter Sarita and brothers Dinesh and Ramesh) have come from Raibrailey to identify his body. They identified him from his teeth, which they claimed had a typical formation. Secondly, he also used to carry a cloth with him." Meanwhile, Manphul said the police would still procure viscera and DNA samples to ascertain the identity of the dead man. The cause of death will also be ascertained once the postmortem report is received. Panic had gripped the area when an unidentified body of a man was found burnt under mysterious circumstances near railway tracks in Sector 82, Mohali on June 13. Police said that the body was spotted by a passerby at 8.30am. The police have not ruled out the possibility of murder in the case. On getting the information, area DSP Ramandeep Singh said that a team of local police along with CIA staff and forensic experts rushed to the spot. A special team of government railways police was also summoned from Patiala. On April 27, a partially burnt body of a 'five-month pregnant' woman was found near MDC police station in Panchkula. The deceased has been identified as Arti alias Anu (38), a resident of Surajpur near Pinjore. Cops said that she had been strangulated before being burnt by her paramour and his brother. Later, the accused were were arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Chandigarh: \u2018Pedicure, vitamins, we.description: CHANDIGARH:The rooster which has robbed the peace of a military veteran is living no ordinary life. The bird is fully vaccinated against poultry diseases, maintains a high-level of hygiene, gets a pedicure often and is given a liver tonic, according to the owner, as she reacted to the police complaint against her pet. That’s not all. Brownie is given vitamins daily for a good immunity system, has been dewormed once and his next deworming date is coming close, she said. “Other than this, our Brownie has had liver tonic for good health and is completely vaccinated against poultry diseases. Cleanliness is a big thing in our home and we clean Brownie’s living space daily, using products like Dettol for his bedsheets and phenyl for our floors for better hygiene. He is given a bath once a week, nails are trimmed and beak filed. We give him oregano oil pedicures,” said the owner in a communication sent to TOI on Monday. The reply, in which the bird owner requested not to disclose their identity, also stated that the complainant has been creating undue pressure on them to forcefully remove Brownie from their home, which, according to her, is illegal. Major H S Dilawari, a retired veteran and senior citizen residing along with his wife at Army Flats, Sector 47, Chandigarh, has given a complaint to police seeking action against his neighbour, whose pet has been disturbing his peace. “Being senior citizens me and my wife are dealing with multiple health problems for which a sound rest is needed which is constantly broken with loud cock-adoodle doo during early hours and in the afternoon. Catching up on sleep again is impossible,” the veteran has mentioned in his police complaint. He has also stated that it has also become a nuisance for the whole building, with hygiene being a big concern as bird flu can affect small children in the building. While police complaint has mentioned that nuisance is created by a rooster and hen, the woman in her response to the complaint has claimed that she only has a pet rooster. It has also been claimed that the drain and staircase in the society, which is a shared space, has been cleaned only them. She claimed the complainant has been pressurizing them to leave their rented house by complaining to her landlord and creating problems. “For them, he might be just a rooster, but for us, he is a beloved family member, who has been with us since he was three weeks old. I have raised him like my own, have fed him from my hands and he sleeps on my lap. Compassion towards animals is lacking in people these days. This harassment has saddened me and my family greatly,” said the woman. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Complete works in Sultanpur Lodhi by Sep.description: Sultanpur Lodhi: Reviewing preparations for 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev in the historic town, Punjab chief secretary Karan Avtar made it clear to the officials that all the ongoing works must be completed before September 30. Chairing a meeting to review the preparations of the mega event here at office of the market committee, the chief secretary, accompanied by commissioner Jalandhar Division B Purusartha and inspector general of police Naunihal Singh said the celebrations during the mega event would start from November 5 and holy city would witness huge rush of devotees till November 15, so all the ongoing development works needed to be completed before September end. He said any sort of callousness would not be tolerated at any cost. “The commemorative events must be a spectacular show for which every officer must perform their duty zealously,” he said. The chief secretary said any sort of inordinate delay in execution of work was unwarranted and undesirable. He also said that besides ensuring prompt execution of work, the officers must also make sure that the work was conducted as per the highest specifications of quality. In a big bonanza for the residents of Sultanpur Lodhi, he said Bebe Nanki Memorial University College for Girls would start professional courses like BCA and BCom from July 1, adding that this would provide an opportunity to girls from the region to have an access to quality education. Avtar said three tented places to facilitate around 40,000 pilgrims would come up in around 280 acres of land in Sultanpur Lodhi. He said special arrangements would be made to ferry the pilgrims via rail and road route to the Gurdwara Sahib. Avtar further said fencing of Kali Bein would be done at 2-km area to avoid any sort of mishap. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Denied leave to share research in German.description: CHANDIGARH: On being denied leave to present a research paper in Germany, MCM DAV assistant professor Renu Bala of physics department moved the Punjab and Haryana high court, and justice was duly served. Bala along with Vinok Ashokan and former Panjab University vice-chancellor Kare N Pathak were called to present their research paper at FH Munster University of Applied Sciences in Germany on a fully sponsored programme by the German government. However, Bala was denied the desired leave by her college that cited her requirement in admission duty for the upcoming admissions. The principal allowed her a leave, but only till June 23. Bala then approached the high court seeking allowance to visit to Germany for the programme between June 15 and July 7. The court in its order observed that Bala’s tickets were booked and a visa to her was issued by the German government. MCM DAV College PRO Ashish said Bala left the country for the programme after the court’s order. Associate professor Renu Bedi, dean sciences and head of physics department, said the authorities should encourage and feel proud when teachers are given opportunities to visit abroad to attend conferences/ workshops, that too fully sponsored. “The NAAC and NIRF rankings of colleges are also based on such achievements,” Bedi said. The professors’ research paper is on theoretical condense matter physics that studied the physical properties of quantum nanowire, such as the flow of electrons. The study has potential applications in building superfast quantum computers that are only talked about and have not been a reality so far. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PGGCG-42 likely to start 2 new PG course.description: CHANDIGARH: Post Graduate Government College for Girls, Sector 42, is likely to start two new courses – masters in History and Punjabi, in the new academic session. The last date for online submission of admission forms (centralized admission and non-centralized admission) is June 26. The college, established in 1982, has been accredited ‘A’ Grade by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC). National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2019 has placed the college in the Rank Band between 150-200. The college has a distinction of having been selected under the Unnat Bharat Abhiyan, a national programme of MHRD, Government of India. College principal Binu Dogra said, “The college motto ‘Higher still’ reflects the essence of the institution’s being and motivates it to remain persistent in its efforts to progress further. The college focusses not only on the peremptory requirements of the curriculum but also on co-curricular activities which enhance the innate talents of the young minds, our nation’s future and pride.” The 18-acre campus houses 60 spacious classrooms, 23 smart classrooms, seminar room, conference room, multimedia room, placement cell, exclusive IT block, auditorium, well-stocked library, a gymnasium hall, 39 fully equipped computer, language and science laboratories, spacious and hygienic food court, daycare centre, life sciences research lab and landscaped parks. The college is under 24x7 CCTV surveillance facility and provides high-speed Wi-Fi connectivity and on-campus ATM facility. The college caters to the needs of physically disabled/ visually impaired students by providing them with facilities like ramps, washrooms, wheelchair and tactile paving. The college boasts of Sabras, a state-of-the-art auditorium which can accommodate around 550 students The college has one hostel which can accommodate around 265 students. The admissions in the hostel are strictly on merit basis. The hostel rooms are spacious and well-furnished. The hostel mess and the kitchen have been renovated recently along with the washrooms.
